programme.desc: Caf√© Hon: The Caf√© Hon restaurant in Baltimore is struggling because its owner has alienated the local community. Can Gordon help?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Chiarella's: Gordon Ramsay visits South Philadelphia, where struggling family-run restaurant Chiarella's is pushing owners Tommy and Dina DeFino's marriage to the brink.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Have a Summer: Adam worries about being hazed by the older students when he goes to high school, but he soon earns their respect by body-slamming Barry.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Breakfast Club: Adam works on a new persona that he hopes will make him seem cool on his first day at high school, while Beverly gets her teaching certificate.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Heavy Is the Head: Will Phil have to rethink his property dream? And Cam has to go to hospital but refuses to have an MRI scan because of a traumatic childhood incident in a well.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Finding Fizbo: Cam is enraged when he sees a clip of someone desecrating his beloved Fizbo costume, so he sets out on a quest to restore Fizbo's good name.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants to find out if they've continued to follow his advice. How have Down City, Classic American and Davide fared in his absence?

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits four restaurants he tried to help: the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, and Kingston Caf√©, La Frite and Capri in California.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Road Trip: Jake tries to do something nice for Amy when he invites her boyfriend Teddy along on a work trip. It's a shame Amy's about to dump him...

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The Pontiac Bandit Returns: Doug Judy is back in custody after scamming Peralta and Diaz when they last met, but Captain Holt offers him a plea deal.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season: After seeing A Christmas Carol on TV, Homer realises he's been too selfish and decides to make amends, culminating in a 'nice-off' with Ned Flanders.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens, and Gays: When a baby riot breaks out at a children's concert, the town's childless community form an anti-youth lobby.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Han Ukkah Solo: When Beverly talks Erica into writing a Hanukkah song for the school holiday concert, she inspires Barry to prove his own musical prowess.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: O Captain! My Captain!: Beverly hopes to inspire the students when she takes over as substitute teacher in Barry's chemistry class. Adam embarrasses Emmy.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Catch of the Day: Phil is convinced he's going to have a bad luck day after failing to complete his daily superstition. Mitch is certain that Cam is undermining him.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Sex, Lies, and Kickball: Jay's best friend, Shorty, returns from Costa Rica and stays at the house so that they can reconnect. And Alex is ready to shed her good-girl image.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Sabotage: Peralta thinks someone's trying to sabotage his professional life, but Santiago and Diaz aren't convinced. Boyle, Hitchcock and Scully work on a tricky case.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: AC/DC: Peralta injures himself chasing a suspect but won't take time off to recover. Holt and Diaz have an awkward dinner date with their significant others.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Big Fat Geek Wedding: On the eve of their nuptials, Edna calls it all off with Principal Skinner. As Marge consoles Edna, she realises her own relationship isn't so great.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Catch 'Em if You Can: Homer and Marge abscond for a romantic weekend in Miami, so Bart and Lisa chase them across the country to ruin their holiday.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Emotions flare as the McQueens gather for a family therapy session. Rex makes a gesture to repair the past, and one resident finds themselves in the wrong place at the wrong time.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Squirt and the Whale: The Simpsons put up a wind turbine in their back garden. Lisa has an upsetting experience when she attempts to free a beached whale.

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Barrister Sarah meets Dan, an ex-military man guilty of too many dad jokes. And besties Megan and Ellena are out on a double date hoping to have their trust in men restored.

programme.desc: George! George Glass!: Adam risks bodily harm during a game of paintball to impress his latest crush, and Erica pretends that she has a college-aged boyfriend.

programme.desc: It's the Great Pumpkin, Phil Dunphy: Phil and Claire want to celebrate Halloween in a big way, but no one else seems to share their enthusiasm for it.

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.desc: John Paul calls in a favour from his new friend Smithy, but can he be trusted? Dillon has a proposal for Donny, and a revelation leaves a relationship on shaky ground.

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: (1995) Mel Gibson stars in this Oscar-laden epic as William Wallace - Scottish freedom fighter, rousing orator and keen face painter - who led his army into England, threatening the throne.

programme.title: Censor
programme.desc: (2021) Prano Bailey-Bond's subtle horror with Niamh Algar. Things get personal for a film censor who harbours unresolved family trauma, working during the video nasties panic of the 1980s.

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy
programme.desc: (2020) Supernatural thriller and standalone sequel to 1996's The Craft. A teenager discovers that she has magical abilities. But they come with dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Hail the Conquering Hero
programme.desc: (1944) Satirical wartime comedy starring Eddie Bracken as a man who becomes a celebrated war hero despite having been medically discharged from the marines after only a few weeks.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts
programme.desc: (1963) Classic interpretation of the Greek myth of Jason's quest to find the Golden Fleece, boasting the enduring work of special effects maestro Ray Harryhausen. Directed by Don Chaffey.

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller with Alex Pettyfer and Mickey Rourke. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy to take on the man who killed his dad and is planning to unleash a deadly virus.

programme.title: Gemini Man
programme.desc: (2019) Will Smith stars in Ang Lee's action-thriller as both an over-the-hill hitman and the young clone of himself sent to take him out. With Clive Owen.

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: (2003) Superhero fantasy. Ben Affleck is a blind lawyer who turns vigilante by night. Jennifer Garner plays his lover and Colin Farrell the villain who endangers them both. Strong violence.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: (2007) Nicolas Cage is Marvel's soul-hunting, hot-headed-biker antihero. When Mephistopheles's son starts causing trouble in hell, Ghost Rider is forced to sort it out. With Peter Fonda.

programme.title: Riders of Justice
programme.desc: (2020) Darkly comic thriller with Mads Mikkelsen. A soldier recruits three geeks to help him hunt down his wife's killer. In Danish/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: LumoTV: Deaf Jams: Rhythm and...
programme.desc: ...Lyrics: Rapper MC Geezer teams up with drum 'n' bass icon Harry Shotta as best mates Luke and Lisa chase their dream.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Devil at 4 O'Clock
programme.desc: (1961) Drama. Spencer Tracy stars as an unfairly unpopular priest living on a volcanic South Sea island which is about to erupt. With Kerwin Matthews, Frank Sinatra and Barbara Luna.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: The Violent Men
programme.desc: (1955) Cold War-influenced western starring Glenn Ford and Edward G Robinson. A smallholder stands alone against the expansionist plans and brutal tactics of a tyrannical rancher.

programme.title: Arabesque
programme.desc: (1966) Gregory Peck stars in Stanley Donen's spy thriller. An Oxford professor is unwittingly drawn into a deadly web of political intrigue. With Sophia Loren and Alan Badel.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Le Mans '66
programme.desc: (2019) Oscar-winning sports drama starring Matt Damon and Christian Bale. In the 60s, Ford set out to build a car that can defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans race.

programme.title: Knock at the Cabin
programme.desc: (2023) M Night Shyamalan's jarringly intimate end-of-days horror with Dave Bautista. An armed group insist that a family of three must make an impossible life-or-death choice.

programme.title: Chevalier
programme.desc: (2022) Exuberant historical costume drama. Kelvin Harrison Jr stars as prodigiously talented French-Caribbean swordsman and composer Joseph Bologne, who literally out-fiddled Mozart.

programme.title: Blue Bayou
programme.desc: (2021) Justin Chon's poignant drama about a man of Korean descent who is threatened with deportation from the US even though he was adopted into an American family when he was three.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: (1951) Western starring Randolph Scott. Four brothers leave the defeated South to seek jobs as the US recovers from the Civil War. As one becomes a railwayman, the others turn to crime.

programme.title: The Black Arrow
programme.desc: (1948) Historical adventure. A man (Louis Hayward) returns from the Wars of the Roses to learn from his uncle that a family friend has killed his father. But is everything as it seems?

programme.title: To Hell and Back
programme.desc: (1955) Fact-based wartime drama. Audie Murphy, America's most decorated soldier in WWII, plays himself in this dramatic recreation of the valiant heroics that earned him the honours.

programme.title: Censor Interview Special
programme.desc: Star Niamh Algar and director Prano Bailey-Bond talk about making their new psychological horror film, Censor.

programme.title: Canyon Passage
programme.desc: (1946) Frontier western starring Dana Andrews. An ambitious businessman journeys to rural Oregon where a complex web of life and love waits to ensnare him. Directed by Jacques Tourneur.

programme.title: Legends of the Fall
programme.desc: (1994) Oscar-winning turn-of-the-century drama with Brad Pitt and Anthony Hopkins. A Montana patriarch's son falls for his brother's fianc√©e, setting off a tragic chain of events.

programme.title: A Man Called Otto
programme.desc: (2022) Darkly-tinged but ultimately feel-good comedy starring Tom Hanks as a grumpy misanthrope who spends his time badgering people into following society's rules. But why is he like this?

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller about a British couple who get drawn into a Russian mafia conspiracy. With Ewan McGregor, Naomie Harris, Stellan Skarsg√•rd and Damian Lewis. Based on John le Carr√©'s novel.

programme.title: My Family

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Imperfect Strangers: Family fun with the insane Harpers. Ben and Susan look forward to a night out in a town where nobody knows their names when they visit Janey at university.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: The Second Greatest Story Ever Told: The comedy with big laughs and ratings to match. Susan's feathers are ruffled when Nick lands the plum part in an amateur theatrical production.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Waiting to Inhale: Time to pick up some parental tips in the domestic sitcom - or maybe not. Susan is worried that Michael is being led astray by a more adventurous classmate.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Misery: Janey is appalled when her mother comes to visit at university - especially when she begins to reminisce about her own student days. How sad is that?

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Auto Erotica: The country's number one domestic sitcom with fine actors Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker. Nick wins an old car in a poker game, and intends to break it up for parts.

programme.title: The Supervet: Noel Fitzpatrick
programme.desc: Zizi, Suki & Raffa: We meet a Golden Retriever Poodle cross with painful elbows, a Labrador with constant pain in his front legs and Dachshund who lost the use of her back legs overnight.

programme.title: The Supervet: Noel Fitzpatrick

programme.title: The Supervet: Noel Fitzpatrick
programme.desc: Loki, Hugo & Zahra: A hyperactive Ridgeback has ankle problems, a much-adored family dog has issues with hips, elbows and knees. Plus, a Havana kitten suffers a broken leg.

programme.title: The Supervet: Noel Fitzpatrick
programme.desc: Apple, Rosco & Siam: Apple is an energetic puppy who is referred to Fitzpatricks with an ankle problem, while four-year-old Collie Cross Rosco arrives with suspected hip dysplasia.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The crews reassure a frightened elderly patient with a dislocated hip, treat a baby with a dangerously high temperature, attend a woman with a fast heart rate and help an alcoholic.

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The blue lights are flashing as the crews attend a woman with dangerously high blood pressure, a 20-year-old with chest pains, and a woman who has smashed her face in a fall.

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: VW Golf Cabriolet: Derek and Paul are off to Leeds on a rare father and son road trip to pick up a VW Cabriolet and a Lotus Elite.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: Jaguar Challenger XJ6: A beautiful looking sports car has been fooling the punters and intriguing Derek. It's a Challenger E-Type - a fibreglass replica created from an E-Type mould.

programme.title: Bangers & Cash
programme.desc: 1961 Morris Minor 1000: Paul and Jack head to Staffordshire to pick up five vehicles from collector Rob's colossal barn, including a Mini and a Morris Minor.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: An Enigma Variation: Mercifully politically incorrect comedy. All is chaos as Rene attempts to hide the stolen gold. Meanwhile the Resistance plan to steal the Enigma Encoder.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Renewing the Vows: More abuse of the French language. Rene is shocked when Edith accepts Alfonse's proposal. Will he lose the cafe and the gold bars he lifted?

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: The Big Flush: Laughs at the expense of the French, Germans, English and anyone else. Rene decides it's time he quit his dangerous lifestyle - along with the four gold bars.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Who's for the Vatican?: No stone unturned in the quest to send up every nation in the EU. A medal, a suicide pill and a hide-out in the Vatican introduce an old habit to Rene.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler's War
programme.desc: Vernichtungskrieg: Adolf Hitler has his mind on making Germany into a great empire by expanding eastwards, but his invasion of Poland tips the world into a violent and bloody war.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler's War
programme.desc: A Superhuman Act of Inhumanity: Betrayed, Stalin fights the German army in the Soviet states. The German occupation policies lead to the first extermination policies of 'undesirables'.

programme.title: Adolf Hitler's War
programme.desc: Moscow Is Behind Us: As Hitler's troops advance, occupants in Ukraine, Belarus and Poland take the brunt of the occupying forces cruelty; and the first concentration camps are created.

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Hawne Basin to Stourbridge: Disaster strikes when the Naughty Lass collides with a low bridge on the Bumble Hole Canal Branch damaging a chimney.

programme.title: Motorhoming with Merton and Webster
programme.desc: New. Paul and Suki head for Somerset on the next leg of their grand UK tour in their motorhome that has now officially christened as Captain Narrow Squeak.

programme.title: Motorhoming with Merton and Webster
programme.desc: New. Paul and Suki venture into Wales and the Bannau Brycheiniog - Brecon Beacons - National Park for this instalment of their UK motorhoming adventure.

programme.desc: Second World War adventure. A British Army officer sets out to thwart the Nazis by stealing a secret cache of diamonds from a bank in Amsterdam.

programme.desc: A look at the challenge of preserving unspoilt wildernesses, from the icy expanses of Siberia to the tropical forests of central and South America.

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Former footballer Les Ferdinand is coerced into the North Sea in a wetsuit as he joins Robson Green on a short break in Northumberland packed with memories and laughter.

programme.title: Robson Green's Weekend Escapes
programme.desc: Robson and actor Mark Benton go on a humour-filled quest to find ways to relax while exploring the North Yorkshire coast.
